intro: Nemesia brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spurred nemesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Nemesia brevicalcarata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
